verses.text: Blessed \add is\add* he whose transgression \add is\add* forgiven, whose sin \add is\add* covered.
Blessed \add is\add* the man unto whom the \sc Lord\sc* imputeth not iniquity, And in whose spirit \add there is\add* no guile.
When I kept silence, my bones waxed old Through my roaring all the day long.
For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: My moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.
I acknowledged my sin unto thee, And mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the \sc Lord\sc*; And thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
For this shall every one \add that is\add* godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: Surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.
Thou \add art\add* my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; Thou shalt compass me about \add with\add* songs of deliverance. Selah.
I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.
Be ye not as the horse, \add Or\add* as the mule, \add which have\add* no understanding: Whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, Lest \add they\add* come near unto thee.
Many sorrows \add shall be\add* to the wicked: But he that trusteth in the \sc Lord\sc*, mercy shall compass him about.
Be glad in the \sc Lord\sc*, and rejoice, ye righteous: And shout for joy, all \add ye that are\add* upright in heart.
